SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.cli.scene

Class SceneManager

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.view.cli.scene.SceneManager
public class SceneManager extends Object
The SceneManager is used for handling transitions between scenes of the CLI.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description

  • Field Details

    • isRunning

      public final AtomicBoolean isRunning
      To check if the Manager is currently running. It's value is true at construction.

    • isStarted

      public boolean isStarted
      Boolean that is true if the SceneManager has been started.

    • cli

      public final CLI cli
      The CLI that uses the SceneManager. It must be saved because the scenes need to call methods provided by the CLI.

    • scenes

      public final Map<Class<? extends Scene>,Scene> scenes
      A map from the class to the constructed scene itself

  • Constructor Details

    • SceneManager

      public SceneManager(CLI cli)
      Parameters:
      cli - the CLI that is using the SceneManager

  • Method Details

    • registerScene

      public void registerScene(Scene scene)
      Registers a scene. At most one scene for each class can exist at a time.
      Parameters:
      scene - the scene to register

    • setInitialScene

      public void setInitialScene(Class<? extends Scene> initialScene)
      Sets the initial scene. Must be called before setting starting the SceneManager and returns early if it has already been started.
      Parameters:
      initialScene - the initial scene

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the SceneManager and installs the AnsiConsole. This method can be called only once. Returns early if no initial scene has been set or if the method has already been called.

    • transition

      public void transition(Class<? extends Scene> scene)
      Updates the current scene to the given one. Calls onExit() of the old scene and onEntry() of new one.
      Parameters:
      scene - the class of the scene to transition to

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the SceneManager, uninstalls the AnsiConsole and closes the game. Returns early if the SceneManager isn't running.

    • handleInput

      public void handleInput(String input)
      Handles the input provided by the user.
      Parameters:
      input - the user input

    • getCurrentScene

      public Class<? extends Scene> getCurrentScene()
      Current scene as Class getter.
      Returns:
      the Class of the current scene
